title: Trump attacks Biden as he defends controversial call with Ukrainian president
text:
Getty Images President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence attend a meeting on religious freedom at United Nations headquarters on Monday in New York.

President Donald Trump on Monday attacked Joe Biden as he defended his discussion with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky — a conversation that has come under heavy scrutiny and is overshadowing Trump’s visit to the United Nations.

‘PERFECT PHONE CALL’

In New York for the United Nations General Assembly meeting, Trump was asked about the Ukraine scandal and how seriously he is taking Democrats’ talk of impeachment.

“Not at all seriously,” the president replied. “We had a perfect phone call with the president of Ukraine.” Trump pivoted to attacking Biden, who is leading most national polls for the Democratic presidential nomination, by saying, “What Biden did was wrong.” The Wall Street Journal has reported that Trump in July pressed Zelensky to investigate the business dealings of Biden’s son Hunter in Ukraine.

Read: Trump repeatedly pressed Ukrainian president to investigate Biden’s son

Biden said on Saturday he had never discussed with his son any overseas business dealings and called for Trump to be investigated.

CLIMATE AND RELIGIOUS FREEDOM MEETINGS

Trump spent less than 15 minutes at a climate-change summit and headlined a religious-freedom event at the UN.

Now see: Greta Thunberg to climate-focused UN: ‘You have stolen my childhood ... with empty words’

Trump said he planned to dedicate $25 million to protecting religious sites and relics and announced a coalition of businesses focused on religious freedom that he said would “encourage the private sector to protect people of all faiths in the workplace.”

The president also had one-on-one meetings with the leaders of Pakistan and Poland, as well as other countries, at the UN.
